content.paragraph: There are four simple guidelines for Effective Participation in Online Groups:

listitem.link: delete the text of the previous messsage
use the group to share files

content.paragraph: You may receive a lot of email via your Online Group. The point of this is to increase communication but to do this effectively. You should be able to tell whether a post is relevant to you or not just by reading the subject line. If it isn't, you can get a sense of what is going on in the group without even reading it. Even if you do open and skim read it, unless you want to respond or act on the post, you can delete it. You can always go to the Topics area to find it again.

Many people find it useful to keep all of the posts in an email folder. You can even set up a rule or filter to put them there automatically. If you prefer, you can delete the emails from your Inbox as you receive them and read them in the Topics area when you are ready.

Stick to the topic described in the subject line. If you are responding on the same topic, use the same subject line. If you are starting a new topic, create a new email and give it an appropriate subject line. Look at the Topics area of your Online Group now to see how it organises posts into a readable sequence. You can configure some email clients to support this (known as "threading") as well.
content.heading2: Delete the Text of the Previous Messsage
content.paragraph: Delete the text of the post you are replying to. Keep your post as short and to-the-point as possible. The text is already in the Topics area. Quote from the previous post minimally and clearly.
content.heading2: Use the Group to Share Files
content.paragraph: You can share files with an Online Group in two ways:

bulletlist.listitem: when sending an email to the group, add one or more files to your email as attachments
when posting a message from this website, click the "Browse" button under the "File" heading and choose one single file to share with the group

content.paragraph: The files will be uploaded to the site, and a link to each file added to your post. A list of the posts with attached files is clearly displayed at the top of the page when viewing a topic.
Benefits of Sharing Files with the Group

numberedlist.listitem: people can choose when they download files (rather than getting them whether they like it or not)
the group can build a single shared collection of files rather than each member having their own set of files that may be different from the shared set
the effort of maintaining an organised collection of files only needs to be done once, rather than by everyone in the group

content.paragraph: You can copy a link to a file or website and paste it into a post to an Online Group.

Some links ("urls") will be broken into two pieces by some email clients. To make them work, join them back together by pasting the two parts into the "address" part of your Web browser one after the other.
These guidelines apply to emails in Online Groups and to email use in general:

bulletlist.listitem: never forward an email (or document) to a third person without the original sender's consent (unless the content is obviously in the public domain)
never send large file attachments without the recipient's consent
never send a person's email address to others without their consent - use "bcc:" (blind carbon copy), not "to:" or "cc:" when sending an email to multiple recipients who don't know each other)
